newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Economy Ministry to handle industry policy.
newsitem.headline: Russian Economy Ministry to handle industry policy.

text.p: Russian Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin has signed a government order increasing the Economy Ministry's power to coordinate industrial policy in key sectors, a government spokesman, Igor Shabdurasulov, said on Tuesday.

Under the decree, the ministry is charged with coordinating a single government policy in the metallurgical, chemical, petrochemical, biotechological, textile, medical, heavy industry (machine-building), defense, timber, cellulose paper, wood products and light industies.
Shabdurasulov told a news conference that the Economy Ministry would also be responsible for coordinating policy for the precious metals and stones mining, refining and polishing industries.
He said the ministry had also been ordered to develop a plan to use state funds as seed money to attract foreign investment.
Under recent sweeping government changes, the Industry Ministry, which has jurisdiction over the various industrial sectors, was dissolved.
